item.title: Central Coast Mariners star Annalise Rasmussen signs with Italian powerhouse Juventus
item.description: A-League leading goal scorer Annalise Rasmussen leaves the competition immediately to join Italian powerhouse Juventus.

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess tells rape trial sex was consensual
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby pleads not guilty to four counts of rape and one of domestic violence but guilty to a count of offensive sexual behaviour.

item.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
item.description: Thousands of Australian parents are struggling with children who cannot go to school. A new podcast and e-book have been released to help support them.

item.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
item.description: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

item.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
item.description: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

item.title: How to know if you're experiencing PTSD
item.description: Louise was experiencing nightmares for five years before being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles
item.description: The federal government provides $2 million towards developing low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles using materials like seaweed and plant sugar.

item.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
item.description: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison
item.description: Emails contained in the Epstein files show former British royal Sarah Ferguson told the convicted child sex offender she knew a "single" woman with a "great body" he should meet, weeks after his 2009 release from prison.

item.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.description: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.description: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

item.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
item.description: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

item.title: Daly River residents being evacuated to Darwin ahead of predicted major flooding
item.description: About 450 people are being evacuated from the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, ahead of expected flood levels of more than 14 metres.

item.title: Ex-prince Andrew leaves Windsor home as British police investigate latest Epstein revelations
item.description: British police are investigating Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor after new files suggest Jeffrey Epstein arranged for a woman to have sex with the former prince at his home at the Royal Lodge in 2010.

item.description: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
item.description: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
item.description: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

item.description: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

item.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
item.description: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

item.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
item.description: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

item.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
item.description: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

item.description: Valentino Guseli only found out he had been added to the big air field a couple of hours before the competition start after a rival's injury, but still found a way to make it to the final.

item.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
item.description: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

item.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
item.description: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

item.description: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

item.description: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

item.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
item.description: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

item.description: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

item.description: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

item.description: The Nationals have proposed spending another two weeks in exile from the frontbench rather than address the Liberals' non-negotiable conditions for a Coalition reunion.

item.description: More than a dozen customers have come forward over concerns two Broome chemists have handed out the wrong medications.

item.description: "I'm paying adult fuel with still a child's wage," says Ben Walker, one of the almost half a million young people who could see a huge boost to their wage.

item.title: UK prime minister's chief of staff Morgan McSweeney quits amid Epstein fallout
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer's leadership is under threat after revelations that one of his former US ambassadors had close ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi leads coalition to landslide election victory
item.description: Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are expected to hold upwards of two-thirds of the seats in Japan's lower house.

item.title: $740m veterans plan to fund social 'rehabilitation' and psychedelic treatments for PTSD
item.description: A $740 million program will expand support for veterans and include funding for social activities such as yoga and language classes, with new treatment including MDMA and psilocybin for the worst forms of PTSD also funded for the first time.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before US Congress as Epstein files reveal more about her role
item.description: This week, Ghislaine Maxwell could be a very unwelcome distraction for Donald Trump as she appears before one of America's top political institutions.

item.title: Thailand PM Anutin Charnvirakul confident of forming government after election
item.description: South-East Asia's second-largest economy went to the polls on Sunday in a tight race between conservatives aligned with the military and the monarchy, and progressive elements represented by the reform-driven People's Party.

item.title: Investors driving up regional house prices with some buying sight unseen
item.description: Local buyers are facing stiff competition from outside investors, with regional house price rises tipped to continue.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds smash Jamaica again to seal three-game series in Perth
item.description: Kate Moloney celebrates her 50-game milestone in style as the Australian Diamonds post a 32-goal victory over an understrength Jamaica in Perth.

item.title: Why Payne Haas's move from Brisbane to South Sydney changes the game for two NRL giants
item.description: Payne Haas's decision to leave Brisbane for South Sydney in 2027 didn't just shock the rugby league world, it transformed the futures of two of rugby league's most powerful clubs in an instant.

item.title: Japanese prime minister confirms sweeping election win
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Businessman and bad gambler Sam Kanjo linked to Australia's biggest illegal tobacco fine
item.description: He's been declared bankrupt repeatedly, and was a gambling addict. Now he's linked to a $1.5 million fine for illegal tobacco.

item.title: Australia's women beaten by New Zealand in Perth Sevens final, but men claim bronze
item.description: The Australian women are forced to settle for silver at the Perth Sevens, while the Aussie men claim bronze in thrilling fashion.

item.title: Bullying surges in ACT public schools as parents, teachers speak out
item.description: Reports of bullying in ACT public schools have risen sharply in four years. Parents and teachers say children are paying the price, and the system is not coping.

item.title: ASX jumps 1.9 per cent in $60b rally, another Optus exec sacked — as it happened
item.description: The ASX has recouped the losses of last week with a broad-based $60 billion rally.

item.title: Gout Gout opts out of Commonwealth Games as he seeks to follow in Usain Bolt's footsteps
item.description: Sprint sensation Gout Gout pulls out of the Glasgow Commonwealth Games in a major blow to the Australian team.

item.title: Israeli President Isaac Herzog tells Sydney event antisemitism has been 'festering' in Australia
item.description: Isaac Herzog was invited by the governor-general and prime minister to join the Jewish community grieving the loss of life in the December 14 massacre of mostly Jewish Australians at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: As AFL prepares to reboot State of Origin, there are hopes it can capture the imagination of a new generation
item.description: The AFL is about to reboot the State of Origin concept, with the clash between Western Australia and Victoria at Perth Stadium next Saturday — on Valentine's Day — set to show if there's any love left for the idea.

item.title: Explain the Internet: Why Wuthering Heights is one of the year's most controversial adaptations
item.description: Days away from the release of Emerald Fennell's highly anticipated adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic novel, critics and fans alike are still fighting about text fidelity in the comments.

item.title: Deua River Valley and Cobargo still rebuilding six years after Black Summer bushfires
item.description: Residents who lived through the 2019-20 bushfires on the NSW South Coast say this summer's fires triggered traumatic memories, and highlighted the recovery and resilience projects that remain unfinished.

item.title: Liberals despair at prospect of 'non-existence' and weigh leadership change after catastrophic Newspoll
item.description: Sussan Ley could face a challenge to her leadership from Angus Taylor this week after a disastrous opinion poll showed the Coalition parties falling further behind One Nation.

item.title: Aussie stars as Seahawks use ferocious defence to claim Super Bowl win
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks overawe the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LX as punter Michael Dickson becomes the second ever Australian NFL champion.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, Breezy Johnson breaks her gold medal — quick hits from day two
item.description: US great Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, and her compatriot breaks her gold medal as Tess Coady sneaks through to the final after a nervous wait on the bubble. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Cyclists slam 'nightmare' shared path at new Sydney Fish Market
item.description: The decision to put a shared bike path in front of the new Sydney Fish Market is causing a clash between commuter cyclists and visitors to the site, riders say.

item.title: Live: Protesters clash with police in Sydney amid chants of 'we will march'
item.description: Thousands of people have gathered across Australia to protest the visit of Israeli President Isaac Herzog. Follow live.

item.title: Backyard pods won't fix the housing crisis but they signal a shift
item.description: Australia's biggest hardware retailer has started selling tiny homes. Are backyard pods the answer to a national housing crisis?

item.title: Iran sentences Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi to six more years in prison
item.description: Women's rights activist Narges Mohammadi is sentenced to a further six years in jail.

item.title: Broome North Primary School students swelter through wet season with broken air conditioning
item.description: Classroom temperatures at Broome North Primary School in the Kimberley are reportedly pushing 30 degrees, with long-reported air conditioning breakdowns yet to be fixed.

item.title: Laura Tingle says Herzog visit links Israel's actions with antisemitism
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 3, Monday, February 9
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: HESTA CEO Debby Blakey resigns after superannuation administration outage
item.description: HESTA's boss is calling it quits after 11 years in the role. Her exit follows an outage that left members unable to access their accounts.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn hailed as 'idol' by downhill rivals after Milano Cortina crash
item.description: Lindsey Vonn's 2026 Winter Olympic Games ended in disaster, but her teammates and rivals have heaped praise on the three-time Olympic medallist.

item.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
item.description: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

item.title: Christchurch terrorist gives testimony in NZ appeal court as he attempts to vacate guilty pleas over 2019 attack
item.description: The convicted Christchurch terrorist and murderer is giving testimony in the New Zealand Court of Appeal as he seeks to vacate his guilty pleas over his 2019 attack on two mosques.

item.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in landmark case
item.description: Jimmy Lai, one of Hong Kong's most outspoken critics of China, has learned his fate after being sentenced this morning.

item.title: Independent inquiry launched into NACC chief's handling of defence ties
item.description: The body responsible for holding the federal integrity watchdog to account will formally investigate it for agency maladministration and its chief, Paul Brereton, for officer misconduct.

item.title: Mitchell Freeway head-on crash in Butler leaves two dead after ute driven on wrong side of road
item.description: A 56-year-old-woman and a 24-year-old man are dead after a head-on collision involving a utility that was being driven on the wrong side of the Mitchell Freeway in Perth's north.

item.title: Five simple, tasty vegetarian recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays
item.description: Looking to add some more vegetarian dishes to your weekly rotation? We have you covered with these five recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays.

item.title: Queensland coroner hears father showed no concern for children caught in fatal house fire
item.description: An inquest has started probing a fatal house fire, with a coroner tasked with trying to determine what sparked it and whether either parent may have been involved.

item.title: NFL Super Bowl LX quick hits: Mack Hollins dresses as a prisoner, Bad Bunny hosts a wedding and Michael Dickson's punts help Seattle Seahawks win
item.description: The most important match of the NFL season crowns a champion, but also provides eye-catching moments on and off the field. Here are five quick hits from Super Bowl LX.

item.title: Dimitri D'Elio, Kylie Stott jailed for Christmas Eve killing of Charlie Gander in Bunbartha, Victoria
item.description: Charlie Gander’s body was found in a burnt-out car on a country road on Christmas Eve, 2022. Today, two people were sentenced to a combined 36 years in prison over his death.

item.title: Family rallies to save pets left behind in Daly River flood evacuation
item.description: When hundreds of people evacuated the Daly River community due to flooding, most had to leave their pets behind. But a nearby family swung into action to help.

item.title: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl half-time show features surprise guests Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin
item.description: Global superstar Bad Bunny performs at the Super Bowl LX, sharing the stage with surprise guests Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin, while a couple weds on stage.

item.title: Ben Batterham receives payout from NSW government for wrongful prosecution
item.description: A Newcastle man will receive a confidential payout from the NSW government for wrongful prosecution by police for an alleged home invasion murder.

item.title: SpaceX to build 'self-growing city' on Moon, Elon Musk says
item.description: Billionaire chief executive says the company will shift its focus from Mars and the project could be achieved within 10 years.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds announces retirement at end of NRL season
item.description: Adam Reynolds will finish his stellar career at the end of the season after fulfilling his Broncos mission to perfection.

item.title: Palestine Action Group loses court challenge to extra police powers
item.description: A Supreme Court challenge was launched by Palestine Action Group on Sunday.

item.title: New gun ownership laws announced by Queensland Premier David Crisafulli
item.description: The laws aim to crack down on rising gun crime and include tougher penalties for drive-by shootings.

item.title: Inside Minnesotan homes these people are hiding from ICE and living in fear for their children and parents
item.description: What was once a hindrance is now "a paranoia like I've never known before", one Minnesotan man says, as his family hides from immigration agents.

item.title: Daly River expected to surpass major flood level before reaching peak
item.description: Flooding at the Daly River community is expected to surpass the major flood level late Monday, with a peak of 14.1 metres expected by Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Heavy rain in central Australia causes celebration and concern
item.description: Rain across central Australia has been welcomed at cattle stations, but flooding and road damage have cut off some remote communities.

item.title: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright fined $10k for landing helicopter in backyard
item.description: The Netflix star, who is currently behind bars on unrelated charges, pleaded guilty to a single count for landing his chopper and taking off in the backyard of his former home in Darwin's rural area.

item.title: Widespread protests against Israeli President Issac Herzog's visit to Australia
item.description: Thousands of people attend protests against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Heavy police presence at Sydney Town Hall as protesters gather
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Another Optus tech 'issue' affects hundreds of thousands of customers
item.description: Optus says an issue is affecting mobile services for some customers, who are seeing "no service" or "SOS" on their device.

item.title: Families of Laos methanol poisoning victims say they've been left in the dark on investigations
item.description: The families of Bianca Jones and Holly Morton-Bowles say they have been left in the dark following the 2024 poisoning deaths of their daughters.

item.title: Sanae Takaichi's stomping victory will have profound consequences for Australia and the Asia-Pacific
item.description: A stomping victory by the ruling coalition government of Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has opened the way for a major geo-strategic realignment in the Asia-Pacific region, with big implications for Australia.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: Live: Freestyle skiing, snowboarding and Australian ice dance duo in action
item.description: Holly Harris and Jason Chan will become the first Aussies in 12 years to represent the country in ice dancing, while Tess Coady and Meila Stalker will compete in the big air final. Follow live.

item.title: Shaun Dunk asks to be 'locked up' 15 days before alleged stabbing murder, court hears
item.description: Fifteen days before he allegedly killed a woman and attempted to kill another, Shaun Michael Dunk asked to be taken into custody so he would not be a danger to anyone.

item.title: Police and protesters clash at Sydney's Town Hall
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Prince William and Kate say they are 'deeply concerned' about Epstein files
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales say their thoughts remain focused on the victims of the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in their first statement on the issue.

item.title: Queensland health minister orders review of Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit
item.description: Announcement comes after a woman reveals her support person was prevented from entering the birth suite while she was in labour by Toowoomba Hospital security.

item.title: Maritime safety regulator investigating luxury Carnival cruise ship after whistleblower concerns
item.description: The maritime union says crew members of a luxury Carnival cruise ship allege they are being made to sleep in crowded rooms, lack access to safe free drinking water, and that some are earning as little as $2.50 an hour.

item.title: Commonwealth files defence against Linda Reynolds legal action in federal court
item.description: The Commonwealth files its defence against former senator Linda Reynolds, who is suing the government and its lawyers over a $2.4 million payout it made to Brittany Higgins.
